body.p:
Hd Qts Pro Mar 5th Dist of Ky
Louisville Augst 31st 1865
To His Excelency
Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Governor
I have the honor to present to you Mr James W. Sweeny -- a poor man unable to pay -- in justice to a large family the amnt of the forfeiture of the bond his petitioners ask his release from --

I am personally acquainted with Mr Sweeny he having been in my employ as a special agent in the Pro Mar Deprt,, And from a knowledge well drawn. I take great pleasure in stating that he is incapable of doing wrong from intention. Thoroughly reliable -- in every thing honest -- And as such I would ask that if consistent he be released from the payment of said bond
(over)
and thereby -- benefit a large and helpless family whose only support is drawn from the petitioner in this case --
With renewed assurances I am Governor very respectfully

Your Obt Servt
G, W, Womack
Capt Pro-Mar-5th Dist of Ky

On account of sickness of my family I am unable to leave home to go to Frankfort in person. I therefore transmit my petition by mail, with this letter hoping it will receive the same attention that my presence would secure
